title: Great Smoky Mountains National Park: Mingo Falls
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Waterfalls     Mingo Falls                Mingo Falls         Robert Crootof Photo  Mingo Falls is on the Cherokee Indian Reservation (Qualla Boundary), just outside Great Smoky Mountains National Park. No special permits are required for access to the reservation. At 120 feet tall, the waterfall is one of the tallest and most spectacular in the southern Appalachians. The hike to the waterfall is only 0.4 miles in length, but is considered moderate in difficulty.  Access Trail: Pigeon Creek Trail  Trailhead: From Oconaluftee Visitor Center, drive south (toward Cherokee) on US-441 and take the second left onto Big Cove Road. At the first stop sign turn left and drive 4.5 miles to Mingo Falls Campground, where the trail begins.    Â   Great Smoky Mountains National Park    Mingo Falls
